# UD Haitian Creole Adolphe

Language: [Haitian Creole](/ht/index.html) (code: `ht`)<br/>
Family: Creole

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.16 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Jephtey Adolphe.

Repository: [UD_Haitian_Creole-Adolphe](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Haitian_Creole-Adolphe)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udht_adolphe216)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.16](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: grammar-examples

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Haitian Creole-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Haitian_Creole-Adolphe/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [ja983&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;scarletmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;rutgers&nbsp;•&nbsp;edu].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

| Annotation | Source |
|------------|--------|
| Lemmas | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD, with some manual corrections of the conversion |
| UPOS | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD, with some manual corrections of the conversion |
| XPOS | not available |
| Features | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD, with some manual corrections of the conversion |
| Relations | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD, with some manual corrections of the conversion |

## Description

This is a treebank for Haitian creole. It contains 3314 sentences and 300,000+ words selected from 1 bible-related source and was annotated programmatically.

Kreyòl (Kreyòl Ayisyen, Haitian Creole, iso-639-1: ht) is the main language of Haïti.



This treebank contains a selection of sentences from the following source:
* "Ann egzamine Ekriti yo chak jou - 2017"

Train: 55,527 tokens
Dev: 6,186 tokens
Test: 10,021 tokens

The sentences/tokens were randomly put into those 3 buckets.


## Acknowledgments

This conversion has been performed by Jephtey Adolphe, a Rutgers University alum.

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3314 sentences and 71734 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 6790 tokens (9%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 14 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: Ing-wen, Jean-Dickens, jw.org, l', n', 'dèt', 'peche', Chia-lung, Jean-Pierre, Jr., kè-sote, sere-sere, tèt-chaje, wo-nivo</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 17 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>INTJ</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>SYM</a>, <a>VERB</a>, <a>X</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 9 word types tagged as particles (PART): a, ann, men, non, pa, pou, t, wi, èske</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 29 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): a, anyen, de, ke, ki, kiyès, kote, kwa, kèlkeswa, ladan, li, lui, lòt, menm, mwen, nou, noumenm, ou, pa, pèsonn, sa, sila, tan, te, toulede, tout, wou, yo, youn</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 32 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): anpil, chak, de, kelkeswa, ki, konbyen, konsa, kèk, kèlkeswa, la, lòt, menm, nenpòt, non, oken, okenn, pa, pifò, plizyè, pyès, sa, sila, sèt, ti, toude, toule, tout, twòp, tèl, yo, yon, youn</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 11 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: de, ki, kèlkeswa, lòt, menm, pa, sa, sila, tout, yo, youn</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 7 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): ap, dwe, ka, pral, se, ta, te</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 4 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: dwe, ka, pral, te</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not use the VerbForm feature.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: se.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 6 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: te, ap, ka, dwe, pral, ta.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 7 relation subtypes: <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>advcl:cleft</a>, <a>compound:svc</a>, <a>flat:name</a>, <a>obl:arg</a>, <a>obl:mod</a>, <a>parataxis:insert</a></li>
<li>The following 6 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>csubj</a>, <a>expl</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>reparandum</a></li>
</ul>
